questions.text: Who played Rick Blaine in 'Casablanca' (1942)?
questions.explanation: Humphrey Bogart played the iconic role of Rick Blaine, owner of Rick's Café Américain.

questions.text: What film features the line 'Here's looking at you, kid'?
questions.explanation: This famous line was spoken by Humphrey Bogart to Ingrid Bergman in Casablanca.

questions.text: Who directed 'Citizen Kane' (1941)?
questions.explanation: Orson Welles directed, co-wrote, produced, and starred in Citizen Kane at age 25.

questions.text: What was the dying word in 'Citizen Kane'?
questions.explanation: 'Rosebud' was Kane's dying word, revealed at the end to be his childhood sled.

questions.text: Who played Scarlett O'Hara in 'Gone with the Wind' (1939)?
questions.explanation: British actress Vivien Leigh won an Oscar for her portrayal of Scarlett O'Hara.

questions.text: What was the first full-length animated Disney film?

options.C: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs

questions.explanation: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs (1937) was Disney's first full-length animated feature.

questions.text: Who directed 'Psycho' (1960)?
questions.explanation: Alfred Hitchcock directed this groundbreaking thriller that revolutionized horror cinema.

questions.text: What was the name of the motel in 'Psycho'?
questions.explanation: The Bates Motel, run by Norman Bates, was the setting for the film's murders.

questions.text: Who played Dorothy in 'The Wizard of Oz' (1939)?
questions.explanation: Judy Garland was 16 when she played Dorothy Gale in this timeless classic.

questions.text: What color were Dorothy's slippers in the book version of 'The Wizard of Oz'?
questions.explanation: In L. Frank Baum's book, the slippers were silver. They were changed to ruby red for the film to showcase Technicolor.

questions.text: Who starred in 'It's a Wonderful Life' (1946)?
questions.explanation: James Stewart played George Bailey in Frank Capra's beloved Christmas classic.

questions.text: What was the name of Charles Foster Kane's estate?
questions.explanation: Xanadu was Kane's vast, unfinished palatial estate in Citizen Kane.

questions.text: Who directed 'The Maltese Falcon' (1941)?
questions.explanation: The Maltese Falcon was John Huston's directorial debut and helped establish film noir.

questions.text: What movie ends with 'Louis, I think this is the beginning of a beautiful friendship'?
questions.explanation: This famous last line from Casablanca was actually added after principal photography was complete.

questions.text: Who played the Wicked Witch of the West?
questions.explanation: Margaret Hamilton's terrifying portrayal made her one of cinema's most memorable villains.

questions.text: What was the first film to win the Academy Award for Best Picture?

options.C: All Quiet on the Western Front

questions.explanation: Wings (1927) won the first-ever Academy Award for Best Picture at the 1st Academy Awards in 1929.

questions.text: Who starred opposite Katharine Hepburn in 'The African Queen' (1951)?
questions.explanation: Humphrey Bogart won his only Oscar for his role as Charlie Allnut in The African Queen.

questions.text: What was the first feature-length film with synchronized dialogue?
questions.explanation: The Jazz Singer (1927) revolutionized cinema as the first feature-length 'talkie' with synchronized dialogue sequences.

questions.text: Who played Rhett Butler in 'Gone with the Wind'?
questions.explanation: Clark Gable's portrayal of Rhett Butler became one of his most iconic roles.

questions.text: What famous line does Gable say at the end of 'Gone with the Wind'?

options.B: Frankly my dear, I don't give a damn
options.C: After all, tomorrow is another day

questions.explanation: This line caused controversy as 'damn' was considered profane, but producer David O. Selznick paid a fine to keep it.

questions.text: Who directed 'Singin' in the Rain' (1952)?
questions.explanation: Gene Kelly and Stanley Donen co-directed this beloved musical about Hollywood's transition to talkies.

questions.text: What silent film star struggled with the transition to talkies?
questions.explanation: Many silent stars struggled with sound, though each for different reasons - some due to voice, others due to changing styles.

questions.text: Who played the Tramp in silent films?
questions.explanation: Charlie Chaplin created and played the iconic Little Tramp character in numerous silent films.

questions.text: What was the first film shot in three-strip Technicolor?

options.D: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs

questions.explanation: Becky Sharp (1935) was the first feature film to use the full three-strip Technicolor process.

questions.text: Who directed 'Rebecca' (1940)?
questions.explanation: Rebecca was Alfred Hitchcock's first American film and won Best Picture.

questions.text: What classic film features the line 'I coulda been a contender'?
questions.explanation: Marlon Brando delivers this famous line in On the Waterfront (1954).

questions.text: Who starred in 'Some Like It Hot' (1959)?

options.A: Marilyn Monroe, Tony Curtis, Jack Lemmon
options.B: Doris Day, Rock Hudson, Tony Randall
options.C: Grace Kelly, Cary Grant, James Stewart
options.D: Audrey Hepburn, William Holden, Humphrey Bogart

questions.explanation: Billy Wilder's comedy featured Monroe, Curtis, and Lemmon in a hilarious Prohibition-era story.

questions.text: What was Orson Welles' first film?
questions.explanation: Citizen Kane (1941) was Welles' feature film debut, which he made at age 25.

questions.text: Who played opposite Audrey Hepburn in 'Roman Holiday' (1953)?
questions.explanation: Gregory Peck starred as the reporter who falls for Princess Ann (Hepburn) in this romantic comedy.

questions.text: What 1950 film featured Gloria Swanson as a faded silent film star?
questions.explanation: Sunset Boulevard featured Swanson as Norma Desmond, a role that paralleled her own career.

questions.text: Who directed '12 Angry Men' (1957)?
questions.explanation: 12 Angry Men was Sidney Lumet's feature film directorial debut.

questions.text: What film noir featured a femme fatale named Phyllis Dietrichson?
questions.explanation: Barbara Stanwyck played the deadly Phyllis Dietrichson in Billy Wilder's Double Indemnity (1944).

questions.text: Who won an Oscar for 'The Philadelphia Story' (1940)?
questions.explanation: James Stewart won Best Actor for The Philadelphia Story, though Katharine Hepburn was also nominated.

questions.text: What was the last silent film to win Best Picture?
questions.explanation: Wings (1927) was both the first and last silent film to win Best Picture until The Artist in 2011.

questions.text: Who starred in 'North by Northwest' (1959)?
questions.explanation: Cary Grant starred in this Hitchcock thriller featuring the famous crop duster scene.

questions.text: What was the first James Bond film?
questions.explanation: Dr. No (1962) introduced Sean Connery as James Bond and launched the legendary franchise.

questions.text: Who directed 'The Searchers' (1956)?
questions.explanation: John Ford directed this Western starring John Wayne, now considered one of the greatest films ever made.

questions.text: What musical featured the song 'Edelweiss'?
questions.explanation: The Sound of Music (1965) featured this touching song sung by Captain von Trapp.

questions.text: Who played Maria in 'West Side Story' (1961)?
questions.explanation: Natalie Wood played Maria, though her singing was dubbed by Marni Nixon.

questions.text: What 1939 film was the first to be shown on television?
questions.explanation: The Wizard of Oz was first broadcast on television in 1956, becoming an annual tradition.

questions.text: Who directed 'Lawrence of Arabia' (1962)?
questions.explanation: David Lean directed this epic biographical film starring Peter O'Toole.

questions.text: What film features the shower scene with screeching violins?
questions.explanation: Bernard Herrmann's screeching violin score for the Psycho shower scene is one of cinema's most famous moments.

questions.text: Who was the first actress to win an Oscar for Best Actress?
questions.explanation: Janet Gaynor won the first Best Actress Oscar at the 1st Academy Awards for three films.

questions.text: What classic horror film featured Boris Karloff as the monster?
questions.explanation: Boris Karloff's portrayal of Frankenstein's monster in 1931 became iconic.

questions.text: Who starred in 'To Kill a Mockingbird' (1962)?
questions.explanation: Gregory Peck won an Oscar for his portrayal of Atticus Finch.

questions.text: What was the name of the spaceship in '2001: A Space Odyssey'?
questions.explanation: Discovery One was the spacecraft in Stanley Kubrick's 2001: A Space Odyssey (1968).

questions.text: Who directed 'The Third Man' (1949)?
questions.explanation: Carol Reed directed this noir thriller set in post-war Vienna with Orson Welles.

questions.text: What Hitchcock film featured Kim Novak in a dual role?
questions.explanation: Kim Novak played both Madeleine and Judy in Vertigo (1958).

questions.text: Who played opposite Humphrey Bogart in 'The Big Sleep' (1946)?
questions.explanation: Lauren Bacall, Bogart's real-life wife, starred opposite him in this Raymond Chandler adaptation.

questions.text: What film features the line 'You talking to me?'
questions.explanation: Robert De Niro improvised this famous line while filming Taxi Driver (1976).
